actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on Appropriations, H. Rept. 93-663.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #613 (295-8).
Referred to Senate Committee on Appropriations.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Appropriations with amendment, S. Rept. 93-614.
Measure passed Senate, amended, roll call #575 (90-0).
Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 93-736.
Motion to recommit Conference Report to the Committee of Conference passed House, roll call #704 (216-180).
Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 93-745.
House agreed to conference report, roll call #717 (329-10).
House receded and concurred in certain Senate amendments.
House receded and concurred in certain Senate amendments with an amendment.

official_title: A bill making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1974 and for other purposes.

summary.text: (LATEST SUMMARY) Supplemental Appropriations Act - Makes supplemental appropriations for various executive departments and agencies, the legislative branch, the Executive Office of the President and related agencies for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1974. Provides that no part of any appropriation under this Act shall be available to the Secretaries of the Interior and Agriculture for use for any sale of unprocessed timber from Federal lands west of the 100th meridian which will be used as a substitute for timber from private lands which is exported by the purchaser, except for specific quantities of grades and species of timber which the Secretaries of Interior and Agriculture determine are surplus to domestic lumber and plywood manufacturing needs.

titles.title: A bill making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1974 and for other purposes.
